servinfo.title: Suspension Control Arm Removal and Installation

s1.ptxt: Detach front height sensor (if equipped) from suspension control arm for left side referring to Height Sensor Removal and Installation (If Equipped) .
Depress foot brake pedal and hold it. Remove drive shaft nut (1).
Disconnect tie-rod end (1) from steering knuckle (2) with puller (3).
Disconnect ball joint from steering knuckle (2) with puller and then remove suspension control arm (2).

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Suspension Control Arm / Steering Knuckle Check

s1.ptxt: Install suspension control arm bolts (1) and tighten suspension control arm nuts (2) temporarily by hand.

attention2.ptxt: If reuse suspension control arm nut, apply engine oil to thread and bearing.

s1.ptxt: Connect suspension control arm (1) to steering knuckle and then tighten new suspension control arm ball joint nut (2) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: Never reuse the removed suspension control arm ball joint nut.

torqueitem.t-part: Suspension control arm ball joint nut

s1.ptxt: For self-locking nut type, connect tie-rod end (1) to steering knuckle (2) and then tighten new nut (3) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: Never reuse the removed tie-rod end nut.

s1.ptxt: For castle nut type, connect tie-rod end (1) to knuckle (2). Tighten tie-rod end nut (3) to specified torque. And then, install new cotter pin (4) as shown in the figure.

attention3.ptxt: After tightening tie-rod end nut to specified torque, match next first slot of nut with hole of tie-rod end for insertion of cotter pin (rotation angle 60° max).

s1.ptxt: Depress foot brake pedal and hold it there. Tighten new drive shaft nut (1) to specified torque.
Caulk drive shaft nut (1) as shown.
Connect front height sensor (if equipped) to suspension control arm for left side referring to Height Sensor Removal and Installation (If Equipped) .
Tighten wheel nuts to specified torque.
Tighten suspension control arm nuts to specified torque with vehicle weight on suspension.

attention2.ptxt: It is the most desirable to have vehicle off hoist and in non-loaded condition when tightening them.
